page.title: 20SHOPPING FACILITIES
page.content: Burntwood has a number of shopping centres.Chasetown High Street was the original mining village centre and it retains the character of that era. Sankey's Corner (SK045094)is more central to the expanded modern town and has been named Burntwood Town Shopping Centre;despite this and its modern shops many locals prefer the older High Street.Other centres include:Swan Island on the site of the earliest hamlet of Burntwood;and three purpose built neighbourhood shopping centres with six or so shops each.There are also a number of single or grouped "corner shops".Hammerwich village has one General Store/sub-post office. Despite its size Burntwood has few higher order shops:no chain stores or department stores.People travel to other centres nearby where the weekly markets attract many customers.
